Package pl.bristleback.server.bristle.api.action

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ActionExceptionHandler<T extends Exception>
    This interface should be implemented when special reaction for more or less specified exception is required.
    ActionInterceptor<T>
    Every action can be intercepted by any number of action interceptors.
    ActionInterceptorContextResolver<T>
    This helper interface serves as a interceptor context object provider for each interception operation type.
    ActionInterceptorMatcher
    Using implementations of this interface, user can easily organize action interceptors and assign them to actions without Intercept annotations.
    ActionParameterExtractor<T>
    In addition to custom value serializers, action controller uses parameter extractors for resolving action parameters that canâ€™t be resolved using serialization engine.
    ClientActionSender<T>
    By default, client actions must return one of the following object types: SendCondition implementation UserContext implementation List of UserContext implementations To extend this behaviour, you need to create a class implementing this interface.
    DefaultAction<U extends UserContext,T>
    Classes implementing this interface contain default actions ready to be executed by clients.
    SendCondition<T extends UserContext>
    Basic filter interface, used to determine message recipients.
